poem:
Title: The Tactics of Dissent 

Across the heartland, students stand, 
For the distant cries of a far-off land. 
A web of dissent finds its form, 
Around campuses, a new norm. 

But the campus of free thought's marred,
By the truncheon's echo, blue and hard. 
Liberty, to each their own measure,
Yet, silence looms over freedom's treasure.

"Dissent," says Biden, "Keep it neat," 
But true change comes not on bended knee.
